frameDefinitions: An Agent acts to  cause a Experiencer to feel a certain emotion.
A Speaker communicates about a Topic in such a way as to mislead an Addressee, either by telling outright lies or by presenting a message in a misleading form.
An Agent intentionally seeks to bring about an internal mental or emotional state in the Experiencer.
Some phenomenon (the Stimulus) provokes a particular emotion in an Experiencer.
A flying Vehicle comes to the ground at a Goal in a controlled fashion, typically (but not necessarily) operated by an operator.
The words in this frame describe situations in which an Agent or a Cause injures a Victim.
frameExamples: I was so <t>offended</t> by her behaviour towards me.
I <t>lied</t> to you about your Christmas present.
Nightmare on Elm Street <t>scared</t> me silly.
A police helicopter <t>landed</t> just outside my neighborhood at around midnight last night.
Rod saw his father <t>beating</t> his mother.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who's action's cause an emotion in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The Experiencer feels an emotion as caused by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that evokes emotions in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>. This <fen>Event</fen> occurs as the direct result of a sentient being's actions.
When the Agent causes emotion in the Experiencer.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Experiencer</fen> to feel the emotion.
The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a deceptive Message to the Addressee.
The person that receives a Message from the Speaker.
<fen>Topic</fen> is the entity to which the proposition or propositions  relate, that they are about.
The time at which the deception occurs.
The location at which the deception occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is an External Argument of the target word and purposefully arouses an emotional state.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to have a particular emotional state.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> affects the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> affects the <fen>Experiencer</fen>
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> reacts emotionally or psychologically to the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the event or entity which brings about the emotional or psychological state of the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has an emotion as caused by the <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Vehicle</fen> comes to the ground, usually (but not necessarily) under the control of an operator.
<fen>Goal</fen> is any expression that tells where the <fen>Vehicle</fen> ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the aircraft lands.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the landing occurs.
<fen>Agent</fen> is the person causing the <fen>Victim</fen>'s injury.

The <fen>Victim</fen> is the being or entity that is injured.  If the <fen>Victim</fen> is included in the phrase indicating <fen>Body_part</fen>, the <fen>Victim</fen> role is tagged on a second role layer (see 3rd example).
The <fen>Body_part</fen> identifies the location on the body where the bodily injury takes place.
The <fen>Cause</fen> marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that inflicts harm on the <fen>Victim</fen>
<fen>Time</fen> identifies the time when the harm-causing event occurs.
<fen>Place</fen> identifies the place where the harm causing event occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>You</fex> will perhaps be affronted by my frankness
<fex>Politicians</fex> do nothing but tell lies about money.
You deceived me <fex>about the location of the diamonds</fex>.
<fex>The news</fex> greatlyalarms all the women of the village.
Most of the planes set down <fex>on the strip</fex> before midnight.
<fex>Jolosa, who</fex> broke a rival player 's jaw, was told to model his play on the England striker.
Someone bashed <fex>him</fex> on the back of the head with a heavy smooth object.
Someone bashed him <fex>on the back of the head</fex> with a heavy smooth object.
Riot police in Nairobi clubbed four women unconscious <fex>on March 3</fex>.
Boys  are punched <fex>at school</fex> for payback

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Fastest Clock in the Universe
The Fastest Clock in the Universe
The Fastest Clock in the Universe
